newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Dec 2.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Dec 2.

text.p: These are leading stories in afternoon daily Le Monde.
-- Seasonnally adjusted number of jobseekers decreased by 12,000 in October, totalling 3,100,800.
-- Food group Danone buys Saint-Louis 's stake in Panzalim prepared-meal firm for an estimated 2.9 billion francs.

-- KPMG Fiduciaire de France audit firm suspected of errors in auditing the accounts of publisher Magnard and of bankrupt furniture maker Dapta Mallinjoud. Both firms may seek legal action against KPMG.
-- French banks to tackle market activities in Asia.
-- Shareholders in Pallas Stern bankrupt bank to try and reach agreement over bank's possible bailout plans.

-- Employers' federation chairman Jean Gandois calls for increased flexibility of labour regulations, adds wants the end of legal control of firms' layoff plans, which he says is too long and complex.
